content.description: This could have been a really fun route, but the rock quality surrounding it just isn't there. The crack itself is a fun finger crack with great locks, but the huecos surrounding it are falling apart. Maybe worth setting a top rope up on after climbing another route, but not worth heading out to climb for its own sake.
content.protection: Gear thin to 1" and nuts (which are super useful for the bottom). A gear anchor at the top can be set with 3-4" pieces.
content.location:
Obvious left leaning finger crack on the left side of the main wall.

For top roping an easy scramble around to the left will let you set up a gear anchor. Probably best to bring a long cordelette for the anchor.

content.description: Overall a solid line with good rock following the namesake crooked crack. The crack steadily widens from tight hands to wide fists where it is easier to climb around the crack on a plethora of large huecos.
content.protection: Gear .5 to 3" with a gear anchor at the top.
content.location:
Easily visible crooked crack located on the right side of the main wall.

For top roping an easy scramble around to the left will let you set up a gear anchor. Probably best to bring a long cordelette for the anchor.
